Bag O' Links - 15/3/2010

Links

  • Enable time tracking in Pivotal Tracker – This is another good service from those guys at pivotal.
  • a good basic CSS – I find this one useful, pretty sure i posted it a few weeks/days ago but i can’t find it.
  • Statusboards roundup – Ours is cooler, but i need to find a way to post a picture that is not completely blurred. :)
  • Basic authentication in Ruby on Rails, in case you forgot – Brian refreshes your memory.
  • Awesome HTML5 google-like charts – screw you IE, srsly.
  • Redis tutorial – from the dudes in ThoughtBot.
  • Scaling with noSQL – a talk from noSQL live in boston.
  • Install MongoDB on MacOS – don’t use Macports, it sucks.
  • Visual Guide to noSQL systems – a graphic explanation about this fascinating ecosystem.
  • Semantic I and B tags? – author raises a good point here. although i’m a fan of <strong> and <em>, this article makes some kind of sense.
  • Make sure your Rails application is cacheing properly – Good idea to double-check apache/nginx too.
  • Git Faq – real life questions answered. good resource. (might wanna read this post from ReinH about Git workflows in agile teams)
  • 7 easy tips to reduce your EC2 cloud expenses – #8 – Use heroku, works for me.
  • Liveblogging at Confoo: Blending NoSQL and SQL – another roundup.
  • Hosting Node.js applicaitons – server installation instructions.
  • CSS3 tutorials and tricks you should now – same as the above.
  • Designing for the web – free book, a must read.
  • MapReduce: explained with pictures! – i still only partially get it. :)
  • Using coffeescript in Rails and even Heroku – another winner from Dr. Nic.

Treasures

  • Eucalyptus – thinking about running your own cloud ? this is a good toy to use.
  • one of the worst controller codes ever – thanks @anathematic. (just the messanger, not the actual author of this hell raised code).
  • Naive-Bayes – Simple Naive Bayes classifier.
  • puppet-manager – a web interface for Puppet.
  • envJS – A pure-JavaScript browser environment with early rubygem support. wow.
  • Ultimate roundup of free UI icons – cool.
  • Showcase of excellent table designs – really good stuff.
  • HTML5 and CSS3 templates – when this HTML5 things will grow teeth, that would be awesome.
  • MenuTree – a simple hierachical command line shell.
  • Benelux – Benchmarking sugar for ruby.
